title: I think racist rant threads should be deleted, not just locked because they "escalated"
body: A racist rant is already bad enough per se and doesn't need to "escalate" to be a problem. Additionally, the level of this problem is such that I believe the proper response should be to delete these threads, not just lock them. A mild response from mods that only comes after a racist rant thread causes consternation and arguments implies that the subsequent arguments, not the racism, were the problem.

The term "pasty white" is definitely not appropriate in my eyes personally.  However, I don't read the thread as a racist rant, but rather a thought-out argument regarding having more diverse characters.  Stating the number of champions with lighter skin tones versus more diverse tones is not racist as it is merely a statement of fact.  And we do allow some discussion of race/gender if it relates to champions and champion design in a respectful or factual way without sparking discussion of real life issues.  If it hadn't devolved into negative discussion, I personally would've allowed it to remain open with an edit to the title to remove the offensive terminology.  Since it was being locked, I can understand why the moderator choose to not use an edit on the title as the thread would die away soon enough.

There was one term use and 15 days ago a mod made the call to lock instead of edit because the thread was getting out of hand.  

In fact, I will state I felt that the thread creator was, for the most part, attempting to remain civil despite being called a racist/sexist and accused of racism.  Having an opinion that you'd appreciate seeing more diverse champions because there aren't as many unique styles as of late and you are an art student that want to see more art styles for champion design is not a crime nor violation of the rules.  Using hate speech, racial slurs, and accusing others of being racist is.
